What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: I know the hiragana, katakana, and some kanji.  Basic grammar of Japanese.
I learned how to read, write, and speak elementary level Japanese. I have more confidence in my speaking abilities now.

I learned how to read and write in the three Japanese alphabets (hiragana, katakana, and a bit of kanji). I also learned how to speak quite a bit of Japanese (for a completely beginner) and I learned conversational styles that are important to Japanese culture.

About 100 kanji characters

Hiragana and Katakana symbols

How to start a conversation in Japanese
This course was a great introduction to the Japanese language. It challenged my time management skills.
The class is too intensive. It will take a while to finish the homework. But the homework is very helpful.

strength was definitely the teachers. The Japanese teachers are all really kind and helpful. They teach well and are really engaging. 

weakness is the textbook we used. I didn't like the textbook at all and there should be a better textbook in the market for learning Japanese.
The class is VERY fast-paced, which is good because you learn a lot, but it's definitely an extremely time consuming class.

Strengths: All professors are very dedicated and patient. The course is very engaging and interesting.


Weakness: The speed of class is very fast and workload is a little heavy.

This is the best class I have ever taken at Yale. If you are unsure which language to take and you have any interest in Japanese culture at all please take this class. Yes there is daily work (more than other languages) but the work is fun to do and you will learn so much Japanese it's crazy. The professors are some of the best people I have ever met.
YES!! If you want to learn Japanese, you will seriously learn it with the best professors!

Yes, I would definitely recommend this course. It is challenging and the workload is a lot because it meets everyday, but the teacher support I received was much better than my other classes. The teachers really care about you and the small class size allows you to really get to know your teachers.

I would recommend this class if they really enjoy learning languages. Considering this is a class that meets every day and has homework every day, it would be a miserable experience to take it if you didn't enjoy it.
I would highly recommend this course to someone who has a serious intention of learning the language.
If you are a student who is passionate about Japanese and interested in Japanese culture for sure take this class.
